column4: Again, does anyone know if the Restricted Drivers thing makes the NVIDIA settings tool, or if it was put on by Envy?
...hm. Perhaps someone ought to suggest to the Ubuntu team to try putting in a "Downgrade" option, just in case.
no no thank you
Do you have an NVIDIA card?
yes I do
Do you have the NVIDIA Settings tool under Applications > System?
no I don't
I take it you tried the screen resolution tool under System > Preferences?

if I  go into screen resolution I dont see a resolution tool, I only have two options, this is a fresh install on this computer but when I did the upgrade from 7.10 i remeber seeing the tool somewhere, now I dont have it
I'm certain that there should be a dropbox with various resolutions. It's not there?
yes that is there, and it only has 320x480 and 640x480
I have a utility for configuring my NVIDIA card, but I can't remember how I got it. Does anyone know if the Restricted Drivers thing does that, or if it was put on by Envy?
I will look around for something like that, I did install the restricted drivers just incase tha helps
If you have it, it ought to be under Applications > System Tools, and have an icon of a green N on a black orb
If you have it, you should be able to get to it by pressing Alt-F2 and then typing "nvidia-settings", without the quotes
Thanks I just found tht online
sorry =/
Any results? Do you have said program?
it won't actually open that program
I guess you don't have it then...
I am going to s ee if its in synaptic
Never tried that. Good idea.
it is in there
To find it quicker, try just clicking on a package and then typing "nvida-settings" and se--ok then download it
